description: Represents a Rados Block Device mount that lasts the lifetime of a pod. RBD volumes support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

fsType.description: Filesystem type of the volume that you want to mount. Tip: Ensure that the filesystem type is supported by the host operating system. Implicitly inferred to be 'ext4' if unspecified.

image.description: The rados image name. More info: https://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/volumes/rbd/README.md#how-to-use-it

keyring.description: Keyring is the path to key ring for RBDUser. More info: https://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/volumes/rbd/README.md#how-to-use-it

monitors.description: A collection of Ceph monitors. More info: https://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/volumes/rbd/README.md#how-to-use-it

pool.description: The rados pool name. Default is rbd. More info: https://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/volumes/rbd/README.md#how-to-use-it

readOnly.description: ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts.

secretRef.description: SecretRef is name of the authentication secret for RBDUser. If provided overrides keyring.
